revised_title: Alfred Barton Rendle: A Pioneering Botanist and Systematic Botany Expert
tldr: Alfred Barton Rendle was a renowned British botanist who specialized in systematic botany and plant taxonomy. He worked at the Department of Botany in the British Museum and made significant contributions to the classification and identification of plant species. Rendle also served as a lecturer, a member of various botanical societies, and played a crucial role in the development of botanical nomenclature rules.
